text:
🦅It's very fascinating to hear so many birds singing and chirping away.
🐦‍⬛And to witness such a vast number of birds of various species at one place. That's Amazing.
🐦During weekends, members of the Kebun Bahru Bird Singing Club, mostly seniors, gathered here with their caged birds to display them, listen to their calls, appreciating, evaluating and comparing with others around them.
🐦🐦‍⬛The entire area explodes into a concert of bird singing serenade.
🦅🐦🦜The birds are mostly Chinese hwamei, red-whiskered bulbul, Indian white-eyes and white-rumped shamas.
Very lively, very mesmerising.
🐧At scheduled periods, the Club organise Bird Singing Competitions.
🐦‍⬛Sadly, this once popular hobby had lose it shine with younger folks.
🦅When we loose this heritage, we loose a part of our cultural legacy.
🪶Fun facts:
In 2018, songbird rearing was designated as Intangible Cultural Heritage by Singapore's National Heritage Board.
Awesome place for bird lover to gather and there is so many value for money good yummy food. There is 4 coffee shop and 1 market nearby here just 5min walk and other one is only 2min walk away.

I like this place as people who are interested in birds gather together to create a great weekend community. There is a birds singing club in action, sometimes organized bird singing competition and sometimes people gathered to have pinic. The atmosphere is relaxing and fun and exciting and enjoying.

Good public community area!

For more details, visit 2bearbear today!
Nice environment.  Morning birds will be a chirpy signature here. Nearby parks. Hawker centre. Sheng Xiong. A good place for retirement except swimming pool. Hmmmm~
